critique: The document is an executive order issued by the President of the United States during World War II, authorizing the Secretary of War to take possession and operate the water and power facilities of the City of Los Angeles due to labor disturbances that were impeding the war effort. The order emphasizes the need to maintain operations and protect the facilities and personnel. It also includes provisions for the management and conditions of employment during the period of government control, and specifies a timeline for returning control to the original management.
